info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:31PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Moffat County through 600 PM MDT... At 530 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Craig, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Craig. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 87 and 95. Colorado 13 between mile markers 74 and 92. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
